arm_group.description: 0.2 mL applied topically to the infrascapular area of the back under occlusive patch conditions 3 times weekly for 3 weeks, following with rest period and a challenge.
0.2 mL applied topically to the infrascapular area of the back under occlusive patch conditions 3 times weekly for 3 weeks, following with rest period and a challenge.
Concurrent control 0.2 mL applied topically to the infrascapular area of the back under occlusive patch conditions 3 times weekly for 3 weeks, following with rest period and a challenge.
Concurrent control 0.2 mL applied topically to the infrascapular area of the back under occlusive patch conditions 3 times weekly for 3 weeks, following with rest period and a challenge.

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose of this study will be to determine the potential of abametapir lotion to induce
      sensitization by repeated topical application to the healthy skin of humans under controlled
      conditions.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dermal Safety Study to Evaluate the Sensitizing Potential of Abametapir Lotion
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled Study to Evaluate the Sensitizing Potential of Abametapir Lotion in Healthy Volunteers Using a Repeat Insult Patch Test Design

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of dermal reactions at the application sites will be assessed clinically using a visual scale that rates the degree of erythema, edema, and other signs of cutaneous irritation
primary_outcome.measure: to evaluate the sensitizing potential of abametapir lotion using repeat insult patch test design

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
